title: Paris, France
summary: Big-icon city with parks, boat rides, and kid-friendly museums.
tips: Start mornings early to avoid crowds at the big sights.
Use parks for mid-day breaks and playground time.
Stay near a central metro line to keep transit simple.

title: Amsterdam, Netherlands
summary: Compact city with canals, bikes, and hands-on museums.
tips: Use the canal cruise as a break from walking.
Parks are easy to reach and stroller-friendly.
Reserve museum times ahead when possible.

title: Prague, Czechia
summary: Storybook architecture and river walks with low travel stress.
tips: Pick a central hotel to keep walks short.
Use tram rides to reduce uphill walks.
Carry coins for public restrooms.

title: Vienna, Austria
summary: Imperial parks, easy transit, and kid-friendly museums.
tips: Prater park is great for a low-cost fun day.
Public transit is easy and stroller-friendly.
Plan palace visits early in the day.

title: Copenhagen, Denmark
summary: Harbor city with castles, playgrounds, and easy day trips.
best_for: Safe city breaks and bike paths
tips: Bike lanes are everywhere, but walking works fine too.
Pack a light jacket for coastal breezes.
Tivoli is great for an evening visit.

title: Budapest, Hungary
summary: River city with thermal baths and big views.
tips: Pick a hotel near the river for easier sightseeing.
Leave time for a short cruise at sunset.
Use island parks for downtime.

title: Venice, Italy
summary: Canals, islands, and a one-of-a-kind city layout.
tips: Use the water bus as your main transport.
Plan a Lido beach afternoon for kids.
Avoid heavy luggage and use central lodging.

title: Florence, Italy
summary: Art, gelato, and day trips into Tuscany.
tips: Choose shaded parks for mid-day breaks.
Book galleries early or plan shorter visits.
Consider a short Pisa day trip.

title: Rome, Italy
summary: Ancient history with plenty of open plazas and parks.
tips: Plan early entry for major sights.
Use parks for breaks and shade.
Keep walking days short for kids.

title: Barcelona, Spain
summary: Beach plus city with huge parks and food markets.
tips: Balance beach time with city sights.
Book popular attractions in advance.
Choose lodging near transit lines.

title: Nice, France
summary: Mediterranean coast with beaches and easy day trips.
tips: Bring water shoes for pebble beaches.
Schedule a short Monaco day trip.
Stay near the promenade for easy access.

title: Dubrovnik, Croatia
summary: Walled city with clear water and island day trips.
tips: Walk the walls early for cooler temps.
Take a short boat to Lokrum island.
Carry sun protection for midday.

title: Mallorca, Spain
summary: Island beaches, easy resorts, and warm water.
tips: Choose a family-friendly beach cove.
Plan a short old-town stroll in Palma.
Use boats for easy water days.

title: Lake Garda, Italy
summary: Lake towns, swimming spots, and mountain views.
tips: Pick one lake town as a base.
Pack swim gear for lakeside afternoons.
Plan a Gardaland day if kids want rides.

title: Salzburg, Austria
summary: Mountain foothills, lakes, and sound-of-music vibes.
tips: Plan a lake day outside the city.
Use cable cars for easy views.
Stay near the old town to avoid driving.

title: Trier, Germany
summary: Roman sites, a compact old town, and riverside views that are easy to do in one day.
tips: Park at a central garage to keep the day walkable.
Bring hats and sunscreen for outdoor Roman sites.
Use the Hauptmarkt area for a simple lunch stop.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, or family-friendly restaurants.

description: Germany's oldest city blends Roman ruins with a compact old town that is easy for families to explore. Kids can walk the Porta Nigra, climb the amphitheater, and still have time for a riverside stroll along the Mosel.

itinerary.title: Morning
itinerary.text: Start at Porta Nigra, then walk to the Cathedral and Liebfrauenkirche.

itinerary.title: Midday
itinerary.text: Lunch around Hauptmarkt, then a quick stop at Karl Marx House or the Toy Museum.

itinerary.title: Afternoon
itinerary.text: Visit the Basilica of Constantine and Kaiserthermen, then head to the amphitheater.

itinerary.title: Late afternoon
itinerary.text: Finish with a Mosel river promenade stroll and an easy return to KMC.

access_note: Trier is easy by car or regional train. From Trier Hbf, the old town is a 15 to 20 minute walk or a short bus ride. If driving, use City Parkhaus or Parkhaus Hauptmarkt and walk into the center.

title: Heidelberg, Germany
summary: Castle views and a riverside old town.
tips: Take the funicular for easy castle access.
Stroll the old town early to beat crowds.
Plan a river walk for a calmer afternoon.

title: Luxembourg City, Luxembourg
summary: Compact capital with parks and stone bridges.
alt: Grand Ducal Palace in Luxembourg City
tips: Use park trails to connect viewpoints.
Keep time for the casemates if open.
Stick to the upper city for easy walking.

title: Baden-Baden, Germany
summary: Spa town with parks, playgrounds, and cable car views.
tips: Ride the funicular for easy views.
Parks are great for picnic breaks.
Keep the day light and flexible.

title: Saarburg, Germany
summary: Small town with a waterfall in the center.
tips: Plan a short walk along the river.
Use the chairlift for quick views.
Bring a light snack for the promenade.

title: Burg Eltz, Germany
summary: Fairytale castle in the forest with scenic walks.
tips: Wear comfortable shoes for forest paths.
Arrive early for parking.
Pack a light snack for the hike.

title: Cochem, Germany
summary: Mosel river town with castle views and riverside stops.
tips: Ride the chairlift for quick views.
Walk the river promenade after lunch.
Plan a short castle visit early.

title: Speyer, Germany
summary: Cathedral city with museums and riverside parks.
tips: Pair the cathedral with museum time.
Use the river paths for breaks.
Keep the day simple and walkable.

title: Mainz, Germany
summary: Riverside city with a compact old town.
tips: Stay near the station for short walks.
Use the river promenade for breaks.
Keep your day pace relaxed.

title: Wiesbaden, Germany
summary: Parks, cafes, and a walkable center.
tips: Plan a park break near the center.
Pick a cafe for a longer lunch stop.
Use flat routes for easy walking.

title: Koblenz, Germany
summary: River confluence with cable car views.
tips: Use the cable car for easy views.
Walk the river promenade after lunch.
Keep the day flexible for weather.

title: Cologne, Germany
summary: Big city day with cathedral views and parks.
tips: Visit the cathedral early in the day.
Use the zoo or park for kid breaks.
Keep the route centered near the river.

title: Frankfurt, Germany
summary: Museums, river walks, and skyline views.
tips: Pick one museum area to keep it simple.
Use Palmengarten for open space breaks.
Plan skyline photos near the river.

title: Mannheim, Germany
summary: Grid city with big parks and family attractions.
tips: Plan a long stop at Luisenpark.
Keep a relaxed pace for kids.
Use the water tower area for photos.

title: Saarbrucken, Germany
summary: Riverside capital with parks, a market square, and easy family walks.
tips: Start near the old town so everything stays walkable.
Use the river promenade for a mid-day break.
Pair the zoo or garden with a shorter museum stop.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Saarbrucken is a compact riverside capital where families can mix historic sites with park time. The old town, castle district, and St. Johanner Markt are close together, and the river promenade plus large gardens keep the day relaxed for kids.

itinerary.title: Morning
itinerary.text: Start at Ludwigskirche, then walk through the old town to Saarbrucken Castle.

itinerary.title: Midday
itinerary.text: Lunch around St. Johanner Markt and a short riverside stroll.

itinerary.title: Afternoon
itinerary.text: Pick either the Saarbrucken Zoo or Deutsch-Franzoesischer Garten for a longer family stop.

itinerary.title: Late afternoon
itinerary.text: Finish with a quick museum visit or a relaxed walk along the Saar.

access_note: Saarbrucken is easy by train or car. From Saarbrucken Hbf, the old town and St. Johanner Markt are a 10 to 15 minute walk or a short bus ride. If driving, use the A6 or A620 and park near the castle or city center garages.

title: Bingen am Rhein, Germany
summary: Rhine valley views and riverfront walks.
tips: Plan a short boat ride if available.
Bring a light jacket for river breezes.
Keep the route along the riverfront.

title: Ljubljana, Slovenia
summary: Compact capital with a riverside old town, parks, and easy day trips.
best_for: Walkable city base and low-stress days
tips: Use the riverbanks for easy stroller-friendly walks.
Plan castle time early to avoid crowds.
Build in a park break each afternoon.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Ljubljana is a relaxed, walkable capital with riverfront cafes, small museums, and a castle overlooking the old town. Families can explore on foot, keep days short, and use nearby parks and playgrounds to reset.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Old town stroll from Preseren Square to Dragon Bridge, then a riverside dinner.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Castle funicular and views, then a long play break in Tivoli Park.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Hands-on museum stop and market lunch, then a slow river walk.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Easy day trip to Lake Bled or Postojna, return for an early night.

recommended_stops: Preseren Square and the Triple Bridge
access_note: Fly into Ljubljana Joze Pucnik Airport and use a taxi or rental car to reach the city center in about 30 minutes. The old town is best explored on foot.

title: Lake Bled, Slovenia
summary: Iconic lake with an island church, castle views, and easy scenic walks.
best_for: Classic family scenery and gentle walks
alt: Lake Bled with the island church
tips: Walk the lakeside loop early for calmer paths.
Use the boat ride as a kid-friendly break.
Plan a short castle visit for views.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Lake Bled is a classic alpine lake destination with an easy lakeside loop, a boat ride to the island, and a castle that kids love. The town is compact, and most highlights are reachable on foot with short drives for nearby nature stops.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Lakeside loop and a relaxed dinner by the water.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Bled Castle visit and boat ride to the island.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Morning at Vintgar Gorge, afternoon at Straza Bled.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Optional day trip to Lake Bohinj or a slower lake day.

access_note: Fly into Ljubljana and drive about 35 to 45 minutes to Bled. The lake loop is easiest on foot once you park near the promenade.

title: Lake Bohinj, Slovenia
summary: Quieter alpine lake with easy hikes, waterfalls, and wide-open scenery.
tips: Start mornings early for the waterfall walk.
Use the lake for a long picnic break.
Pack layers for cooler alpine evenings.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Lake Bohinj is a calmer alternative to Bled with a wide shoreline, easy trails, and a slower pace that works well for families. Kids can mix waterfall walks with cable car views and long lakeside afternoons.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Ribcev Laz lakeside loop and a picnic by the water.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Savica Waterfall in the morning, then a lake swim or paddle.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Vogel cable car for alpine views, easy hike at the top.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Mostnica Gorge walk and a relaxed afternoon by the lake.

lodging: Apartments and chalets near Ribcev Laz
access_note: Fly into Ljubljana and drive about 1 hour 15 minutes to Bohinj. Once parked in Ribcev Laz, most of the lakefront is walkable.

title: Triglav National Park, Slovenia
summary: Alpine park with lakes, waterfalls, and family-friendly hikes.
alt: Alpine scenery in Triglav National Park
tips: Choose short trails with big views for kids.
Pack rain layers and quick snacks.
Use cable cars or scenic drives to reduce hiking time.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Triglav National Park delivers classic alpine scenery with viewpoints, lakes, and waterfalls that can be done in half-day bursts. Families can base in nearby towns, choose shorter trails, and still get the wow factor without long hikes.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Easy lakeside stop at Lake Jasna and a short riverside walk.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Drive the Vrsic Pass for viewpoints and a short ridge walk.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Pericnik Waterfall hike and a relaxed afternoon in Kranjska Gora.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Zelenci Nature Reserve boardwalks and a picnic stop.

access_note: Fly into Ljubljana and drive roughly 1 hour 20 minutes to Kranjska Gora for an easy base. Roads are mountain routes, so take it slow in bad weather.

title: Soca Valley, Slovenia
summary: Turquoise river scenery with adventure activities and easy riverside walks.
tips: Plan river time early for calmer water.
Choose short gorge walks instead of long hikes.
Keep a change of clothes for water play.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: The Soca Valley is all about turquoise water, short gorge walks, and outdoor adventures that older kids love. Families can mix easy trails with rafting or zip lines, then retreat to small town centers for low-key evenings.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Arrive in Bovec, explore the river trail, and settle in.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Rafting or tubing in the morning, picnic lunch by the river.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Kozjak Waterfall hike and Kobarid Museum.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Tolmin Gorge loop and a relaxed afternoon swim.

access_note: Fly into Ljubljana, then plan a 2 hour drive to the Soca Valley. Roads are scenic and winding, so allow extra time and plan breaks.

title: Postojna and Predjama, Slovenia
summary: Family favorite caves and a cliffside castle with short walks.
tips: Bring a light jacket for the cave temperature.
Book cave tickets early in peak season.
Combine the castle with a shorter town stop.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Postojna is a family favorite thanks to the cave train ride, dramatic formations, and the nearby cliffside Predjama Castle. It is an easy base for a short visit with plenty of indoor options if the weather turns.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Arrive and explore Postojna town center, early dinner.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Postojna Cave tour and Proteus Vivarium visit.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Predjama Castle and a short countryside walk.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Optional add-on: quick trip to Ljubljana or Piran.

access_note: Postojna is about a 45 minute drive from Ljubljana Airport. The cave complex is easy to reach by car and has large parking areas.

title: Piran, Slovenia
summary: Venetian-style coastal town with short walks and easy beach time.
best_for: Relaxed seaside days and easy strolling
alt: Piran old town on the Adriatic coast
tips: Park outside the old town and walk in.
Plan a short wall walk before midday heat.
Use nearby Portoroz for sandy beach time.

map.legend: Toggle points of interest, parking garages, recommended restaurants, family-friendly restaurants, or indoor attractions.

description: Piran is a compact coastal town with a car-free core, sea views, and short walks that work well for families. Pair the old town with a beach afternoon in Portoroz to keep the pace relaxed.

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.text: Tartini Square and harbor walk, sunset gelato.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.text: Piran Walls and St. George Church, then a beach stop.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.text: Maritime Museum or Aquarium, slow seaside afternoon.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.text: Optional day trip to nearby coastal towns or salt pans.

lodging: Family apartments in Piran old town
access_note: Fly into Ljubljana and drive about 1 hour 30 minutes to the coast. Park in a garage outside the old town and walk in to avoid narrow streets.
